intro: Platanthera chiloglossa, commonly known as the narrow-lipped twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. The plant has a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, which aid in nutrient uptake. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat.
